title: Settings Menu
custom_preconds: Given the user want to configure the setting on his ballpark app

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched the app
and has navigated to the bottom tab bar (Ballpark, Inbox, Journal, and Settings), the user has tapped on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user has navigated to the Settings menu

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the MLB.com Account button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the MLB.com Account page
and the user will see an area to enter their email & password
and the user will see a tappable link to the Privacy Policy page
and the user will see a tappable link to the Forgot Password page
and the user will see a Log Out button that is only active if they are logged in already

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the Accounts page
and the user taps the privacy policy link
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be brought to the privacy policy page
and the user will see a carrot(back) button
and the user will see privacy policy information

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the accounts page
and the user taps the forgot password link
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be be brought to the forgot password page
and the user will see a carrot(back) button
and the user will see a text input field with greyed out text that says email

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the forgot password page
and the user enters a valid email address
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will receive an email with a temporary password and a link to the MLB.com profile page

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the accounts page
and the user taps the log out button
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will be brought to the login page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the ticket accounts
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be brought to the ticket accounts page
and the user will see the following:

IF the user is new/never purchased a ticket previously with their current account
- the user will see an "link account" button

IF the user has purchased tickets and they are already linked to the account
- the user will see a cell with "don't see your tickets?" that is accompanied by a link account button
- the user will see a divider that contains the text "ticket accounts"
- the user will see cells with tickets linked to the account
it will contain the team name, email address, account number, and an unlink button

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the Favorite Team button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the Teams page index
and the user will see a back button
and the user will see an edit button
and the user will see favorite team (if they have any if not then it will be hidden from view)
and the user will see all AL and NL teams listed out by alphabetical order

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user is on the favorite teams page
and the user taps the edit button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will go through the editing favorite team flow
(listed in the step below)

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user is editing favorite teams
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see a green plus button on the left side of all AL and NL teams
and the user will see a red minus button if there are existing favorite teams
and the user will see the hamburger icon on the right side of favorited teams IF there are any existing
and the user will be able to do the following actions:
- add favorite teams by tapping the green plus button
- remove favorite teams by tapping the red minus button
- move around priority of favorited teams by tap and dragging the hamburger icon

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the Sharing button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the Sharing menu
and the user will see a toggle for Facebook and Twitter
and the user will see a 'Back' button on the top left

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user has tapped on the Sharing button
and the toggle is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then social sharing will be enabled or disabled depending on the state of the toggle 
And if the user is logged out they will be prompted to log in and vice versa

Repeat for each social network (Facebook, Twitter)

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user has accessed the settings menu
and the user has tapped on the check-in button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be brought to the check-in settings page
and the user will see a carrot back button
and the user will see a text informing users about what checkin essentially does
and the user will see a toggle for auto check-in

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user has accessed the settings menu
and the user has tapped on the notification button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be brought to the set notification page
and the user will see a toggle for allowing global notification
(IF the global notification is toggled off all views listed below will be hidden)
and the user will see a toggles for "at the game" (You're checked in, You're near Ballpark Attraction, and Upgrade & Premier Experience)
and the user will see a toggle for From MLB.com Partners(Promotions & Giveaways)
and the user will see a toggles for "ticket and event info" for all MLB teams

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user has accessed the settings menu
and the user has tapped on the about ballpark button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will be brought to the about page
and the user will see a carrot back button
and the user will see a about header centered at the top
and the user will see the app version
and the user will see the build number
and the user will see the device they are using
and the user will see the model
and the user will see the iOS version
and the user will see the Network Connection
and the user will see the mobile carrier
and the user will see the email address signed in with
and the user will see the PID
and the user will see the ID1
and the user will see the ID2
and the user will see the ID3

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the Terms & Conditions button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be brought to the Terms & Conditions page
and the user will see a back button at the top left
and tapping the back button will bring the user back to the Settings page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the MLB.com Account button
and the user taps on the Privacy Policy link
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Privacy Policy page
and the user will see a carrot back button on the top left
and tapping that button will bring the user back to the MLB.com Account page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the FAQ button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the FAQ page
and the user will see a 'Back' button at the top left
and tapping the 'Back' button will bring the user back to the Settings menu

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the Contact Us button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The user will get prompted to Leave at the Ballpark and open the link in Safari
if the user clicks no then the message will disappear and the user will remain on the Settings page
if the user clicks yes then the they are brought to the Contact form page on MLB.com site via Safari

title: User is navigated to settings menu upon tapping "Settings" from the bottom main navigation
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has launched the app
AND has navigated to the bottom tab bar (Ballpark, Inbox, Journal, and Settings), the user has tapped on Settings
custom_expected: THEN the user has navigated to the Settings menu

title: WHEN user taps MLB.com Account button in settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the MLB.com Account button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the MLB.com Account page
AND the user will see an area to enter their email & password
AND the user will see a tappable link to the Privacy Policy page
AND the user will see a tappable link to the Forgot Password page
AND the user will see a Log Out button that is only active if they are logged in already

title: User is navigated to privacy policy (webview) page upon tapping "privacy policy" on MLB.com page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is on the Accounts page
AND the user taps the privacy policy link
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the privacy policy page
AND the user will see a carrot(back) button
AND the user will see privacy policy information

title: User is navigated to forgot password page upon tapping "forgot password" link
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is on the accounts page
AND the user taps the forgot password link
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the forgot password page
AND the user will see a carrot(back) button
AND the user will see a text input field with greyed out text that says email

title: Upon entering valid email on forgot password page, user gets email with temporary password and link to MLB.com profile page
User is brought to the login page upon tapping log out button on the account page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is on the accounts page
AND the user taps the log out button
custom_expected: THEN the user will be brought to the login page

title: WHEN the user taps on the ticket accounts in the settings menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the ticket accounts
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the ticket accounts page
AND the user will see the following:

IF the user is new/never purchased a ticket previously with their current account
- the user will see an "link account" button

IF the user has purchased tickets and they are already linked to the account
- the user will see a cell with "don't see your tickets?" that is accompanied by a link account button
- the user will see a divider that contains the text "ticket accounts"
- the user will see cells with tickets linked to the account
it will contain the team name, email address, account number, and an unlink button

title: WHEN user taps on the favorite team button from settings menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the Favorite Team button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the Teams page index
AND the user will see a back button
AND the user will see an edit button
AND the user will see favorite team (if they have any if not then it will be hidden from view)
AND the user will see all AL and NL teams listed out by alphabetical order

title: User goes through editing favorite team flow WHEN user is on favorite team page and taps the edit button
custom_steps:
WHEN the user is on the favorite teams page
AND the user taps the edit button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will go through the editing favorite team flow
(listed in the step below)

title: Editing favorite teams
custom_steps: WHEN the user is editing favorite teams
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a green plus button on the left side of all AL and NL teams
AND the user will see a red minus button if there are existing favorite teams
AND the user will see the hamburger icon on the right side of favorited teams IF there are any existing
AND the user will be able to do the following actions:
- add favorite teams by tapping the green plus button
- remove favorite teams by tapping the red minus button
- move around priority of favorited teams by tap and dragging the hamburger icon

title: **Upon tapping Social Sharing button in settings, sharing menu is displayed with options of Facebook and Twitter
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the Sharing button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the Sharing menu
AND the user will see a toggle for Facebook and Twitter
AND the user will see a 'Back' button on the top left

title: **User can ON/OFF social sharing option by tapping the toggle
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user has tapped on the Sharing button
AND the toggle is tapped
custom_expected:
THEN social sharing will be enabled or disabled depending on the state of the toggle 
AND if the user is logged out they will be prompted to log in and vice versa

Repeat for each social network (Facebook, Twitter)

title: User taps "check-in" button in settings menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the settings menu
AND the user has tapped on the check-in button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the check-in settings page
AND the user will see a carrot back button
AND the user will see a text informing users about what checkin essentially does
AND the user will see a toggle for auto check-in

title: User taps on "Notification" button in settings menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the settings menu
AND the user has tapped on the notification button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the set notification page
AND the user will see a toggle for allowing global notification
(IF the global notification is toggled off all views listed below will be hidden)
AND the user will see a toggles for "at the game" (You're checked in, You're near Ballpark Attraction, and Upgrade & Premier Experience)
AND the user will see a toggle for From MLB.com Partners(Promotions & Giveaways)
AND the user will see a toggles for "ticket and event info" for all MLB teams

title: User taps on "About Ballpark" button in settings menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the settings menu
AND the user has tapped on the about ballpark button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the about page
AND the user will see a carrot back button
AND the user will see a about header centered at the top
AND the user will see the app version
AND the user will see the build number
AND the user will see the device they are using
AND the user will see the model
AND the user will see the iOS version
AND the user will see the Network Connection
AND the user will see the mobile carrier
AND the user will see the email address signed in with
AND the user will see the PID
and the user will see the ID1
and the user will see the ID2
and the user will see the ID3

title: User taps on the "Terms & Conditions" button in settings menu
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the Terms & Conditions button
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the Terms & Conditions page
AND the user will see a back button at the top left
AND tapping the back button will bring the user back to the Settings page

title: User taps privacy policy link in the MLB.com account page
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the MLB.com Account button
AND the user taps on the Privacy Policy link
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Privacy Policy page
AND the user will see a carrot back button on the top left
AND tapping that button will bring the user back to the MLB.com Account page

title: User taps "FAQ" button in settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the FAQ button
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the FAQ page
and the user will see a 'Back' button at the top left
and tapping the 'Back' button will bring the user back to the Settings menu

title: User taps "Contact Us" Button in settings
custom_steps:
WHEN the user has accessed the Settings menu
AND the user taps on the Contact Us button
custom_expected:
The user will get prompted to Leave at the Ballpark and open the link in Safari
if the user clicks no then the message will disappear and the user will remain on the Settings page
if the user clicks yes then they are brought to the Contact form page on MLB.com site via Safari
